cause.description:
Lymphangioleiomyomatosis, better known as LAM, is a progressive lung disease that affects women almost exclusively, usually during their childbearing years. LAM often goes misdiagnosed as asthma, emphysema, or chronic bronchitis. Scientists estimate that there could be as many as 250,000 LAM patients worldwide
1. We need to pay more attention to this disease.
cause.mission: Bring awareness to people about this disease.
cause.name: LAM (lymphangioleiomyomatosis)
